assignmentList.title: Due in 1 day
assignmentList.socialStudyFact: Philippines is 33 times smaller than the United States

objective: I will learn about social and cultural history of the Philippines.
I will learn about convection by doing a boiling science experiment.
I will learn about the nutritional content of carrots and other ingredients in this recipe.

assignmentList.recipe_fact_one: Pancit Palabok is a popular street food

recipe_content.text: Pancit Palabok is made of rice noodles, vegeables and spices, sauteed together.

substitutesData.substituteDesc: Wheat Flour contains Gluten, would you like to replace it with a Gluten-Free Potato Flour?

ingredientsList.name: Carrots
ingredientsList.lTop: Carrots are cooked and consumed in different ways. They can be mashed, boiled, pureed, grated, fried, steamed, stewed, baked, juiced or eaten row.
ingredientsList.rTop: Carrots are the most commonly eaten root vegetables.
ingredientsList.lBottom: Carrots are typically used in stir-fries and salads but also in soups and added to baby foods. They can be dehydrared or deep-fried to make chips, flakes, and powder.
ingredientsList.rBottom: Carrots are typically orange in color can also be purple, red, green and yellow.

nutrientQuestionList.question: Smell the Paprika. What does it smell like?

recipesPreparationList.info: Soak the rice noodles in water for 15 minutes, Drain and set aside in strainer
Measure 3/4 cup carrots, 3/4 cup green beans and wash them in a medium sizes brocoli (about 3 cups) and set them
Peel and mince 4 cloves of garlic.
Cut the vegetables. Peel and chop 1 medium sized yellow onion. Cut the carrots into matchsticks. Thinly sclice the green beans. And cut the broccoli into small pieces.
Cut and set aside 1/2 cup of green onions and 1 lemon cut in half to garnish the food after it is cooked.
Whisk and dissolve 1/3 ounce paprika in 1/4 cup water.

techniqueList: Simmering is a cooking method in which a food containing liquid is cooked just below the boiling point. The boiling point of water is 100 degree Celsius or 212 degrees Fahrenheit. For comparison, water freezes at 0 degrees Celsius or 32 degrees.

Simmering is a cooking method in which a food containing liquid is cooked just below the boiling point. The boiling point of water is 100 degree Celsius or 212 degrees Fahrenheit. For comparison, water freezes at 0 degrees Celsius or 32 degrees.

Simmering is a cooking method in which a food containing liquid is cooked just below the boiling point. The boiling point of water is 100 degree Celsius or 212 degrees Fahrenheit. For comparison, water freezes at 0 degrees Celsius or 32 degrees.

cookingSteps.info: Heat a saucepan over medium heat. Add 3 tablespoons of cooking oil and saute the minced garlic until golden brown.
Add the chopped onions to the saucepan and saute until onions become soft and translucent.
Add the green beans, carrots, and broccoli to the pan. Season with salt and black pepper. Cook for another 3-5 minutes...
Dissolve the paprika in 4 cups of vegetable broth, and pour the mixture into a medium sized pot, stir and...
Add the shrimp bouillon and black pepper to the pot, stir the mixture and simmer for 3 minutes.
Add the 3/4 cup of potato flour gradually while stirring.
Pour the sauted vegetables into the broth and mix it well. Simmer until the mixture becomes a thick sauce and then...
Meanwhile, boil a 6-8 cups of water in a large pot. Submerge the strainer with the rice noodles into the boiling water...
Remove the strainer from the pot and drain the liquid from the noodles.
Place the noodles onto a serving plate.
Pour the sauce onto the noodles and then arrange the green onion and lemon over the sauce.
Heat a saucepan over medium heat. Add 3 tablespoons of cooking oil and saute the minced garlic until golden brown.
Add the chopped onions to the saucepan and saute until onions become soft and translucent.
Add the green beans, carrots, and broccoli to the pan. Season with salt and black pepper. Cook for another 3-5 minutes...
Dissolve the paprika in 4 cups of vegetable broth, and pour the mixture into a medium sized pot, stir and...
Add the shrimp bouillon and black pepper to the pot, stir the mixture and simmer for 3 minutes.
Add the 3/4 cup of potato flour gradually while stirring.
Pour the sauted vegetables into the broth and mix it well. Simmer until the mixture becomes a thick sauce and...
Meanwhile, boil a 6-8 cups of water in a large pot. Submerge the strainer with the rice noodles into the boiling water...
Remove the strainer from the pot and drain the liquid from the noodles.
Place the noodles onto a serving plate.
Pour the sauce onto the noodles and then arrange the green onion and lemon over the sauce.

cleaning.info: Clear off and  wipe down your cooking counter.
Place all used tools into the sink or dishwasher.

Wash your hands with soap and water.

serving.question: Did you know?
serving.answer: 7% of the Earth is covered with water. Water has no calories, proteins, fats or carbohydrates yet it is essential for all living things including humans, animals. and plants.

assignmentList.title: Due in 2 day
assignmentList.socialStudyFact: As of July 2018, Mexican Americans comprised 61.9% of all Latinos in Americans in the United States

objective: I’ll be able to understand new ways to multiply and divide fractions.
I’ll learn about the history of the Mexican-American relations.
I’ll learn how waves transfer energy without transferring mass.

assignmentList.recipe_fact_one: Avocado trees do not self-pollinate; they need another avocado tree close by in order to grow
assignmentList.recipe_fact_two: Avocados are a symbol of love and fertility, and they also grow in pairs on trees.

recipe_content.text: Avocados have the highest fiber content of any fruit and contain vitamin B6, Vitamin C, Vitamin E, potassium, magnesium, and folate.

techniqueList: Sharp knives are safer than dull knives.
Toasting isn’t just for bread, it can be done with many other foods!
For this, let’s grab a pan and put it on the stove.
Next, we can add some nuts into the pan and let them cook.
Stir them around the pan with a wooden spoon to make sure the heat is spread to all the nuts.
Because they are exposed to dry heat, the nuts will start to become more dark brown.

cookingSteps.info: In a medium bowl, mash together the avocados, lime juice, and salt.
Mix in onion, cilantro, tomatoes, and garlic.
Refrigerate 1 hour for best flavor, or serve immediately.

experimentData.desc: WARNING! Perform this experiment only under the supervision of a Big Chef.

recipesStepList.info: Three identical drinking glasses, black and white construction paper, adhesive tape, water, thermometer, clock or timer
Wrap one drinking glass in black construction paper and secure with tape.
Do the same with another glass and white construction paper. Leave the third glass bare (this is your “control” in the experiment)
Carefully fill the three glasses with water, and measure the water’s initial temperature.
Put the glasses outside in a sunny place or on a windowsill in direct sunlight.

serving.serveText: Guacamole is usually served cold and with tortilla chips
serving.question: Did you know?
serving.answer: In Mexico, we speak Spanish, the  Capital is Mexico City and we use the peso as our currency.  Our population is about 126 million and our territory is about 1/4th the size of the United States  but before 1845, Mexico had a much larger territory than today.

assessement.question: Avocados have the highest _________ content of any fruit.
Avocados have 4 grams of _________ in each one, on average.
What percentage of land was given up by the Mexicans as a result of the Treaty of Guadalupe?
In Mexico 92.7% of the population report __________ as their only language.
Where does Chef Marco live today?

Chef Marco sells guacamole by the pound on the weekends.  If it costs 50 pesos to make one pound of guacamole  and he sells it for 130 pesos, then what would his profit be if he sells 10 pounds of guacamole?

Chef Marco has been asked to make the guacamole for his cousin's wedding of 150 guests.  If one portion of guacamole feeds 4 guests, then how many portions of guacamole does he need to make for the wedding?

The price of avocados has gone up in the past couple of years.  In 2018  it cost 42 pesos a kilo and in 2020  it costs 70 pesos a kilo.  By what percentage has the cost of guacamoles gone up in the past 2 years?
If 92% of the Mexican population only speaks Spanish then how  many people speak another  language other than Spanish given that the population of 126 million?

assignmentList.socialStudyFact: Italian immigrants, especially those from the South, faced prejudice when moving to America in late 19th century.

objective: I’ll be able to practice adding and multiplying, even with fractions.
I’ll learn about different human senses and what it means to be gluten intolerant.

assignmentList.recipe_fact_one: Caprese salad was enjoyed by many but failed to really catch fire.
assignmentList.recipe_fact_two: King Farouk, in the 1950s, asked his chef for a light afternoon snack and was served a Caprese sandwich.

recipe_content.text: One of the reasons that Caprese salad  is so delicious is because it includes fresh basil and tomatoes. Tomatoes are a great source of vitamin C, potassium, folate, and vitamin K.

linguistic_details.text_two: ‘Salamat, Sa Muling Pagkikita’ means ‘Thank you, See you later!’ in Tagalog

Keep your fingers away from the blade
Keep knives on the table, and never carry them around the room.

nutrientQuestionList.question: Smell the basil leaves. What does it smell like?

recipesPreparationList.info: Preview the lesson plan and recipe.
Please pre-wash all fresh ingredients (vegetables, etc.)
Remember to always keep sharp tools such as knives far from reach.

techniqueList: Sharp knives are safer than dull knives.
A sharp knife can easily cut through vegetables while dull ones do not and can instead cut you accidentally.
To hold the knife properly, use your pointing finger and your thumb, pinch the part of the knife where the handle meets the blade, while the other three fingers grasp the rest of the knife  handle.
While holding the vegetable down with your other hand, curl your fingers inward like a claw to make sure your fingers are safe and that the vegetable is still.
When cutting, walk your fingers back away slightly from the knife with each cut.

cookingSteps.info: Layer alternating slices of tomatoes and mozzarella
Add a basil leaf between each, on a plate
Drizzle the salad with extra-virgin olive oil.
season with salt and pepper, to taste.

experimentData.desc: WARNING! Perform this experiment only under the supervision of a Big Chef.

recipesStepList.info: Boil 2 cups of water in a pot.
Once the water is boiling add the spinach and cook for 10 minutes.
Using a strainer to capture the basil leaves, pour the water into a clear bowl.
Observe how the water is now green from the chlorophyll! Why do you think that is?

serving.question: Did you know?
serving.answer: The Grand Canal is a channel in Venice, Italy. It forms one of the major water-traffic corridors in the city. When eating with guests, Italians do not usually hurry; a meal may last one to four hours.

take_action_acticity.activity_que_one: Imagine if you are a person living in Italy, where most of the foods are made of wheat, and you have Celiac Disease. What would you eat? How would this affect your life?

take_action_acticity.activity_que_two: Why do you think the number of people with Celiac Disease is increasing?
